Beyoncé Knowles tour chronology Dangerously in Love World Tour Verizon Ladies First Tour (2004r.) The Dangerously In Love World Tour was singer Beyoncé's first solo concert tour, intended to showcase songs from her debut solo album, Dangerously in Love. == The show == The stage was simple and featured a large LED screen in the back that moved up and down throughout the entire show and displayed video images of Beyoncé and her dancers, as well as some images from her music videos and some prerecorded images with special effects. The set list included not only Dangerously in Love material, but also contained a special segment of her show dedicated to her erstwhile group Destiny's Child. This concert also featured songs from Beyoncé's 2003 film The Fighting Temptations ("Fever" and "Summertime"). A highlight for many fans was her performance of "Dangerously in Love 2". == Setlist == #"Baby Boy" #"Naughty Girl" Costume Change #"Fever" Costume Change #"Hip Hop Star" #"Yes" #"Work It Out" Costume Change #"Gift from Virgo" #"Be with You" #"Speechless" #"DC Medley": "Bug a Boo"/"No, No, No Part 2"/"Bootylicious"/"Jumpin' Jumpin'"/"Say My Name"/"Independent Women Part I"/"'03 Bonnie & Clyde"/"Survivor" #"Me, Myself and I" #"Summertime" Costume Change #"Dangerously in Love 2" Costume Change #"Crazy in love" == Tour dates == Date City Country Venue Tickets sold Tickets on sale Percentage sold Europe Europe Europe Europe November 3, 2003 Manchester England M.E.N.
